## Data description

```{r}

California_incarceration_rate_data <- read_excel("data/California incarceration rate data.xlsx")
ZIPCodeData2022_1_ <- read_excel("data/ZIPCodeData2022 (1).xlsx")

ca_demographic <- read_csv("data/demographic.csv", skip = 1)
ca_income <- read_csv("data/income.csv")
ca_poverty <- read_csv("data/poverty.csv")
```

```{r}
#| eval: false
#transforming the data

ca_demographic <- read_csv("data/demographic.csv", skip = 1)

ca_demographic <- ca_demographic |>
  select(!(contains("Estimate") | contains("Margin"))) |>
  select((1:5) & (8:17) & (39:41) & 46 & 54 & 59 & 74) |>
  mutate(`Geographic Area Name` = substr(`Geographic Area Name`, 7, 11))
```

```{r}
#renaming the columns
California_incarceration_rate_data <- California_incarceration_rate_data %>% 
mutate(zip_code = `California ZIP codes  `)


ZIPCodeData2022_1_ <- ZIPCodeData2022_1_ %>% 
mutate(zip_code = `ZIP Code`) %>% 
  mutate(zip_code = as.numeric(zip_code))

```

```{r}
joined_data <- full_join(California_incarceration_rate_data, ZIPCodeData2022_1_, by = "zip_code")

```

```{r}
#make sure that the zip codes are not repeated in either dataset
joined_data_clean <- joined_data %>% 
  drop_na() %>% 
  nrow() %>% 
  print()
```

```{r}
joined_data %>% 
  nrow()
```
